Instruction: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease and flour a jelly roll pan or line with parchment paper.
Combine flour, sugar, and baking soda in a large bowl.

In a saucepan, heat 1/2 cup butter, shortening, instant coffee, and cocoa until boiling. Pour the chocolate mixture over the flour and sugar. Add buttermilk, eggs, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Spread the batter into the jelly roll pan.
Bake for around 20 minutes in the oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.

While the cake is baking, make the frosting. In a saucepan, bring 1/2 cup butter or margarine, milk, and 2 tablespoons cocoa to a boil, stirring constantly. Mix in confectioners' sugar and vanilla until smooth. Spread the warm frosting over the cake as soon as it is baked. Let the cake cool before serving.
